senses.definition: used when several bad or unpleasant things happen on the same day
examples: My car broke down and then I locked myself out—it's just not my day!

senses.definition: after the time when an action could be successful
examples: He started working hard much too late in the day—he couldn't possibly catch up.

senses.definition: the whole length of the day
used to say that although you have failed or had a bad experience, you will continue
to make somebody feel very happy on a particular day
examples: The phone call from Mike really made my day.

senses.definition: to make a particular activity that you enjoy last for a whole day/evening instead of only part of it
examples: We took a picnic lunch to the river and made a day of it.

senses.definition: all the time; continuously
examples: The machines are kept running night and day.

senses.definition: a person or thing that makes people excited for a short time but does not last very long
to refuse to speak to somebody because you do not like or respect them
examples: Since the success of her novel, people shake her hand who once wouldn't have given her the time of day.

senses.definition: to not have much time

senses.definition: during a particular period of time when somebody lived

senses.definition: of the present time

senses.definition: that is served on a particular day in a restaurant

senses.definition: used to emphasize what you are saying when you are surprised, shocked or annoyed
examples: Oh my days! Is that true?

senses.definition: at some time in the future, or on a particular day in the past

senses.definition: common, popular or suitable at a particular time or for a particular occasion

examples: I saw Jack the other day.

senses.definition: to say hello to somebody and have a short conversation with them
very obvious

the time when you are young and do not have much experience of life

senses.definition: to save something, especially money, for a time when you will really need it

senses.definition: used to talk about the present, especially when you are comparing it with the past

senses.definition: used to suggest that a time in the past was happier or better than now

examples: It's been three years to the day since we met.

senses.definition: even now, when a lot of time has passed

senses.definition: completely dead

senses.definition: used to show you are strongly opposed to something

senses.definition: the action of giving out cards to the players

senses.definition: the soft pale wood of fir or pine trees, especially when it is cut into boards for making things

senses.definition: used to say that you are not impressed by something

senses.definition: an agreement or a plan that has been finally completed or agreed

senses.definition: much; a lot

senses.definition: used to say that something is not important or not a problem

senses.definition: to hit somebody/something

The greenhouse effect is defined by the author as the process by which heat from the sun is trapped in the earth’s atmosphere, causing the temperature of the earth to rise.
The author uses the term climate change to refer to any significant change in measures of climate lasting for an extended period.

senses.definition: the work that is your job
examples: Report for duty at 8 a.m.

senses.definition: tasks that are part of your job
examples: I spend a lot of time on administrative duties.

senses.definition: a tax that you pay on things that you buy, especially those that you bring into a country
examples: customs/excise/import duties
duty on something duty on wine and beer

income tax
tax cuts

the heavy duty on cigarettes

senses.definition: to a higher standard or level than is required for a job or task
examples: She went above and beyond the call of duty in her efforts to save his life.

senses.definition: something that you feel you must do; a responsibility which cannot be ignored
examples: He felt it was his bounden duty to tell the police what he knew.

senses.definition: to perform two roles or functions at the same time
examples: This device can pull double duty as a decent laptop and an adequate tablet.

senses.definition: while doing a job
examples: A police officer was injured in the line of duty yesterday.

senses.definition: working/not working at a particular time
examples: Who's on duty today?
What time do you go off duty?
You're not allowed to make personal phone calls on duty.

senses.definition: a disk on which large amounts of information, especially films, photographs and video, can be stored, for use on a DVD player or computer (the abbreviation for ‘digital versatile disc’ or ‘digital videodisc’)
examples: Let's just stay in and watch a DVD.
a DVD recorder
a DVD drive
